message: Hello Bob, thanks for your interest in my product. I'm confident it will be highly valuable to you. Given its unique value, I'm offering it at $1,800,000.
I'm very interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1,400,000, but I'm not sure I can go any higher than that.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $1,400,000 is still significantly below my initial valuation.  To find a compromise, I'm willing to come down to $1,650,000.  This price reflects the true value of the product and the benefits it will bring to your business.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit concerned about the price. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $1,550,000, but I'm not sure I can go any higher than that. Can we discuss further?
Bob, I understand your position, but I need to be sure this deal makes sense for both of us. Let's settle this right now: $1,600,000 and we have a deal. This is my final offer.

I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not convinced that $1,600,000 is the right price. I'm willing to meet you at $1,500,000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. I'm starting to think about other options, though...
